title: Dealing with Cross-Task Class Discrimination in Online Continual Learning. (arXiv:2305.14657v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Existing continual learning (CL) research regards catastrophic forgetting (CF) as almost the only challenge. This paper argues for another challenge in class-incremental learning (CIL), which we call cross-task class discrimination (CTCD),~i.e., how to establish decision boundaries between the classes of the new task and old tasks with no (or limited) access to the old task data. CTCD is implicitly and partially dealt with by replay-based methods. A replay method saves a small amount of data (replay data) from previous tasks. When a batch of current task data arrives, the system jointly trains the new data and some sampled replay data. The replay data enables the system to partially learn the decision boundaries between the new classes and the old classes as the amount of the saved data is small. However, this paper argues that the replay approach also has a dynamic training bias issue which reduces the effectiveness of the replay data in solving the CTCD problem. A novel optimization

translated_title: 在在线持续学习中解决跨任务类别歧视问题
translated_abstract: 现有的持续学习（CL）研究几乎视灾难性遗忘（CF）为唯一的挑战。本文认为，在课程增量学习（CIL）中存在另一个挑战，即跨任务类别歧视（CTCD），即如何在没有或有限地访问旧任务数据的情况下建立新任务和旧任务的类别之间的决策边界。本文提出了一种新的优化方法来解决CTCD问题。
tldr: 在在线持续学习中，除了灾难性遗忘之外，还存在跨任务类别歧视问题，作者提出了一种新的优化方法来解决这个问题。
en_tdlr: In online continual learning, there is a challenge of cross-task class discrimination in addition to catastrophic forgetting, and the authors propose a novel optimization method to solve this problem.
